poem:
Title: "An Island As One"

Law's tendrils grip an island whole,
Yet Belfast finds a different role.
A court proclaiming refugee,
A human not an absentee 

DUP, ensconced in power,
In temporal debating tower.
Their lens now forged with fear and disdain,
Yet, in their demur, our gain.

A beacon's glow from Northern shore,
A new dawn whispers, 'welcome more.'
